intro: Luzama collantesii, commonly known as the Sierra Madre nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Sierra Madre mountains in Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped white or purple flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
